intro: Codia albicans var. cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-leaf codia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its pale green to grayish-white leaves that are often covered with a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its unique leaf coloration and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
